title.narrative: (UNICEF) Implementation of Action Plan on the prevention of recruitment and use, and the release of children, from the Myanmar armed forces

description.narrative:
Objective: UNICEF to undertake its commitment under the Action Plan to support meaningful implementation by the Government of prevention of recruitment and release of children from Myanmar Armed Forces and the long-term reintegration of such children in the community
Expected Outcome: Effective disarmament, demobilization and reintegration programmes for children to serve as a critical factor for durable peace and security in Myanmar
Expected Outputs: 1. Release of estimated 5000 children from the Armed Forces of Myanmar. 2. Provision of long term community based reintegration, and rehabilitation support to the released children. 3. Reduction of numbers of children being recruited by the Armed Forces of Myanmar. 4. Reduction in the prosecution and imprisonment of deserters under the age of 18 from the Armed Forces. 5. Inclusion in the regular syllabi of the Armed Forces of Myanmar curricula on human rights, international humanitarian law and child protection. 6.Increased capacity and knowledge on prevention of child recruitment, human and child rights, international humanitarian law and child protection amongst 50% of armed forces personnel. 7.Strengthened compliance by the Government of Myanmar to assume primary responsibility for the protection of all children affected by armed conflict in Myanmar. 8.Access by the United Nations to non-State armed groups in Myanmar that use and recruit children for the purposes of dialogue on halting child recruitment and release of children, and the signature of Action Plans. 9.Strengthened UNICEF response to ensure that the protection, rights, well-being and empowerment of children affected by armed conflict are integrated post-conflict recovery and reconstruction planning and programmes.
